016package de.cuioss.test.valueobjects.generator;
017
018import static java.util.Objects.requireNonNull;
019
020import java.util.Collection;
021import java.util.List;
022import java.util.Map;
023import java.util.Optional;
024import java.util.Set;
025import java.util.SortedSet;
026import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;
027
028import de.cuioss.test.generator.TypedGenerator;
029import de.cuioss.test.valueobjects.generator.dynamic.impl.CollectionTypeGenerator;
030import de.cuioss.test.valueobjects.property.util.CollectionType;
031import lombok.AccessLevel;
032import lombok.NoArgsConstructor;
033
034/**
035 * Registry for instances of {@link TypedGenerator}
036 *
037 * @author Oliver Wolff
038 */
039@NoArgsConstructor(access = AccessLevel.PRIVATE)
040public final class TypedGeneratorRegistry {
041
042    private static final String GENERATOR_MUST_NOT_BE_NULL = "generator must not be null";
043    private static final String TYPE_MUST_NOT_BE_NULL = "type must not be null";
044    private static final Map<Class<?>, TypedGenerator<?>> REGISTRY = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
045
046    /**
047     * Checks whether the registry already contains a {@link TypedGenerator} for the
048     * given type
049     *
050     * @param type identifying the generator, must not be null
051     * @return boolean indicating whether the registry already contains a
052     *         {@link TypedGenerator} for the given type
053     */
054    public static boolean containsGenerator(final Class<?> type) {
055        requireNonNull(type, TYPE_MUST_NOT_BE_NULL);
056        return REGISTRY.containsKey(type);
057    }
058
059    /**
060     * @param type identifying the generator, must not be null
061     * @return the registered {@link TypedGenerator} for the given type or
062     *         {@link Optional#empty()} if none could be found. Consider checking
063     *         first: {@link #containsGenerator(Class)}
064     */
065    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
066    public static <T> Optional<TypedGenerator<T>> getGenerator(final Class<T> type) {
067        requireNonNull(type, TYPE_MUST_NOT_BE_NULL);
068        if (!REGISTRY.containsKey(type)) {
069            return Optional.empty();
070        }
071        return Optional.of((TypedGenerator<T>) REGISTRY.get(type));
072    }
073
074    /**
075     * @param typedGenerator to be added to the registry, must not be null.
076     */
077    public static <T> void registerGenerator(final TypedGenerator<T> typedGenerator) {
078        requireNonNull(typedGenerator, GENERATOR_MUST_NOT_BE_NULL);
079        REGISTRY.put(typedGenerator.getType(), typedGenerator);
080    }
081
082    /**
083     * @param type      identifying the generator, must not be null
084     * @param generator to be set, must not be null
085     */
086    public static void registerTypedGenerator(final Class<?> type, final TypedGenerator<?> generator) {
087        requireNonNull(type, TYPE_MUST_NOT_BE_NULL);
088        requireNonNull(generator, GENERATOR_MUST_NOT_BE_NULL);
089        REGISTRY.put(type, generator);
090    }
091
092    /**
093     * Removes the corresponding {@link TypedGenerator} for the given type
094     *
095     * @param type identifying the generator, must not be null
096     */
097    public static <T> void removeGenerator(final Class<T> type) {
098        requireNonNull(type, TYPE_MUST_NOT_BE_NULL);
099        REGISTRY.remove(type);
100    }
101
102    /**
103     * Clears the registry.
104     */
105    public static void clear() {
106        REGISTRY.clear();
107    }
108
109    /**
110     * Add all basic types provided by {@link JavaTypesGenerator}. In addition it
111     * adds {@link TypedGenerator} for basic Collection-types returning an empty
112     * collection.
113     */
114    public static void registerBasicTypes() {
115        JavaTypesGenerator.allGenerators().forEach(g -> REGISTRY.put(g.getType(), g));
116        REGISTRY.put(Collection.class, new CollectionTypeGenerator<>(Collection.class, CollectionType.COLLECTION));
117        REGISTRY.put(List.class, new CollectionTypeGenerator<>(List.class, CollectionType.LIST));
118        REGISTRY.put(Set.class, new CollectionTypeGenerator<>(Set.class, CollectionType.SET));
119        REGISTRY.put(SortedSet.class, new CollectionTypeGenerator<>(SortedSet.class, CollectionType.SORTED_SET));
120    }
121}
